thread.title: Idaho 911 drug deal goes bad after suspect butt dials cops: 'Dope' is arrested
thread.title_full: Idaho 911 drug deal goes bad after suspect butt dials cops: 'Dope' is arrested | Examiner.com

author: Linsey Bald
title: Idaho 911 drug deal goes bad after suspect butt dials cops: 'Dope' is arrested
text:
Idaho drug deal fail as this fellow butt-dials 911 / Bonneville County Police An Idaho drug deal was cut short when the suspect’s butt dialed up 911 , giving dispatchers some posterior audio of this dope’s attempted marijuana sale. The deal went down – literally for 38-year-old Portland man Lawan Sanders and his girlfriend – after cops showed up and busted the would-be traffickers.
Reports The Associated Press on Oct. 19: “Court records show dispatchers overheard three men talking about selling drugs. They triangulated the call and officers arrived at the location to find three men standing by a car.”
According to reports, on Sept. 27 Sanders and his girlfriend, Charity Fournier, traveled from Oregon to Idaho Falls in order to sell marijuana. Sanders was at a gas station speaking to two other men when he evidently sat down with his iPhone in his back pocket.
The unintentional call came through, and police were able to hear the trio talk about how to break up their large stash of hash and sell the pot in individual baggies. A few minutes later, cops rolled up in an unmarked car and placed the pair under arrest.
According to the Idaho Post Register , Sanders had one bag of marijuana in his pocket and more pot stuffed into a prescription pill inside the vehicle. The men who met Sanders told cops he was going to sell them drugs from his hotel room; a search warrant was obtained, and investigators found half a pound of pot, close to three ounces of cocaine and eight grams of methamphetamine.
Sanders was charged with “possession with intent to manufacture or deliver a controlled substance,” as well as “trafficking in cocaine or a mixture in excess of 28 grams but fewer than 200 grams” – which according to Idaho law carries a mandatory three-year prison term.
The other men were referred to the Bonneville County Prosecutor’s Office for charging decisions. Sanders was released on $50,000 bail. This crook will undoubtedly be the jail cell butt of the joke after calling 911 during his drug deal fail.
